TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ColorPalette extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines an array of colors that make up a color palette. The colors are 32-bit ARGB colors. Not inheritable.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You are not allowed to construct a <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.ColorPalette> object directly. If you created a <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.ColorPalette> object, you could then manipulate the palette size for a particular image, which is not allowed. Use the <xref:System.Drawing.Image.Palette%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to obtain a <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.ColorPalette> object.
The colors in the palette are limited to 32-bit ARGB colors. A 32-bit ARGB color has 8 bits each for alpha, red, green, and blue values. The lowest 8 bits make up the blue bit, the next 8 bits are green, the next 8 bits are red, and the most significant 8 bits are alpha. This means each component can vary from 0 to 255. Fully on is 255 and fully off is 0. Alpha is used to make the color value transparent (alpha = 0) or opaque (alpha = 255). The number of intensity levels in the image can be increased without increasing the number of colors used. This process creates what is called a halftone, and it offers increased contrast at a cost of decreased resolution.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Entries As Color()
public: property cli::array <System::Drawing::Color> ^ Entries { cli::array <System::Drawing::Color> ^ get(); };

Docs.value: The array of structure that make up this .

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Flags As Integer
public: property int Flags { int get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies how to interpret the color information in the array of colors.
Docs.value:
The following flag values are valid:
0x00000001 The color values in the array contain alpha information.
0x00000002 The colors in the array are grayscale values.
0x00000004 The colors in the array are halftone values.
